unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post draft:
normalised: Here's the normalized version of your Quora post draft:

unnormalised: **Subject: Exam Prep Apps: Are they actually helpful, ya?**
normalised: **Subject: Exam Prep Apps: Are they actually helpful, yes?**

unnormalised: So, I'm prepping for my IIT-JEE (again!), and feeling the pressure, especially with the exam date looming – 21/05/2024. Back in my day (2018!), we just had textbooks and maybe some coaching center notes from FIITJEE Delhi. Now, these exam prep apps are everywhere!
normalised: So, I'm prepping for my I I T J E E (again!), and feeling the pressure, especially with the exam date looming – twenty first May two thousand and twenty four. Back in my day (two thousand and eighteen!), we just had textbooks and maybe some coaching center notes from F I I T J E E Delhi. Now, these exam prep apps are everywhere!

unnormalised: Are they genuinely worth it? I’ve downloaded a bunch - Doubtnut, BYJU's, Vedantu... they all promise the moon, right? Unlimited practice questions, personalized learning paths, and even AI tutors. My cousin, Rohan, swears by Unacademy for his UPSC prep, saying the mock tests are killer. He even claims to study at 03:00 hrs sometimes using the app!
normalised: Are they genuinely worth it? I’ve downloaded a bunch - Doubtnut, B Y J U's, Vedantu... they all promise the moon, right? Unlimited practice questions, personalized learning paths, and even A I tutors. My cousin, Rohan, swears by Unacademy for his U P S C prep, saying the mock tests are killer. He even claims to study at three A M sometimes using the app!

unnormalised: But honestly, sometimes I feel like I'm drowning in information. It's easy to get distracted by the 'gamified' learning aspects instead of actually understanding concepts. Also, are the practice papers *really* representative of the actual exam? That's always my biggest concern.
normalised: But honestly, sometimes I feel like I'm drowning in information. It's easy to get distracted by the 'gamified' learning aspects instead of actually understanding concepts. Also, are the practice papers *really* representative of the actual exam? That's always my biggest concern.

unnormalised: I'm especially interested in apps that help with Maths and Physics. I heard Embibe is good for that. Anyone have any experiences to share, especially with apps useful for JEE/ NEET preps? Any tips on making the most of them without getting overwhelmed? Also, are there any free or affordable options? My pocket money only stretches so far, you know! I've got like Rs. 500 left! Any recommendations based on the recent exam pattern changes, like post the 15/08/2023 syllabus update, would be great. Thanks in advance, guys!
normalised: I'm especially interested in apps that help with Maths and Physics. I heard Embibe is good for that. Anyone have any experiences to share, especially with apps useful for J E E or N E E T preps? Any tips on making the most of them without getting overwhelmed? Also, are there any free or affordable options? My pocket money only stretches so far, you know! I've got like rupee five hundred left! Any recommendations based on the recent exam pattern changes, like post the fifteenth August two thousand and twenty three syllabus update, would be great. Thanks in advance, guys!
